title: Federal Judge Denies Request to Block ICE Surge in Minnesota
summary: Local officials had argued that the decision to send some 3,000 immigration agents to Minnesota amounted to a violation of state sovereignty.

title: Bovino Is Said to Have Mocked Prosecutor’s Jewish Faith on Call With Lawyers
summary: Gregory Bovino, the Border Patrol field leader, made disparaging remarks in reference to the U.S. attorney in Minnesota, an Orthodox Jew, people with knowledge of the phone call said.

title: ICE Expands Power of Agents to Arrest People Without Warrants
summary: An internal memo changed the standard from whether people are unlikely to show up for hearings to whether they could leave the scene.

title: How Fear of ICE Upended Life in One Minnesota School District
summary: In Fridley, a Minneapolis suburb, school officials are driving nervous teachers and buying families groceries. At dismissal, the superintendent patrols for federal agents.

title: Kevin Warsh Has a Tough Job Ahead. It’s Not the First Time.
summary: Mr. Warsh is known as a consensus builder, skills he will need if he is to head the Federal Reserve when President Trump is demanding rock-bottom rates.

title: A Hawkish Kevin Warsh at the Fed Could Haunt Bessent
summary: The Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent tried to avoid providing President Trump with a clear recommendation to lead the central bank.

title: For Hassett, Loyalty to Trump Became a Liability in Fed Race
summary: Kevin A. Hassett had been seen as the front-runner in the Fed race, but his deep ties to the president raised questions about his independence.

title: Sell America Is the New Trade on Wall Street
summary: Investors are increasingly souring on the United States, as illustrated by the declining dollar, the stalled stock market and rising government borrowing costs.

title: How Europe Is Moving to Reduce Dependence on Trump
summary: Since President Trump made threats about Greenland, the continent’s leaders have debated the rapid deterioration of U.S. ties in policy papers and at dinner.

title: U.S. Allies Are Drawing Closer to China, but on Beijing’s Terms
summary: As Washington unsettles its partners, Beijing is reaping diplomatic gains, without backing down on human rights, trade or security.

title: Usha Vance’s Pregnancy Becomes a Talking Point
summary: The announcement that the second family is expecting a fourth child has turned Ms. Vance into a symbol of success for proponents of conservative family values.

title: Release of Three Million Epstein Pages Falls Short, Survivors Say
summary: Todd Blanche, the deputy attorney general, told reporters on Friday that “there’s a hunger or a thirst for information that I do not think will be satisfied by the review of these documents.”

title: Here’s What to Know About the Millions of Pages of Epstein Documents
summary: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche signaled that this would be the last major release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Israel Launches Attack in Gaza
summary: A local health official said at least 26 people had been killed in the attacks, which the Israeli military said had targeted Hamas commanders.

title: These Gazans May Finally Get a Lifeline to the World
summary: Thousands of Palestinians are waiting to be evacuated for medical treatment as the border between Gaza and Egypt looks set to reopen in the coming days.

title: They’re Stepping Up on ‘The Pitt’
summary: Four actors discuss the evolution of their young clinician characters on “The Pitt.” In Season 2 they are a little older, a little wiser and still soaked in fake blood.

title: ICE Took Liam Conejo Ramos. His Classmates Have Something to Say.
summary: Letters from students living in fear.

title: Slovenian Sphinx Flick Nixed!
summary: Melania’s movie, not exactly boffo box office.

title: Good Company
summary: Let’s talk about the new and old shows we’ll be watching this winter.

title: Drilling Through the Thwaites Glacier for Clues to Its Melting
summary: A team hopes to place instruments in the waters beneath the colossal Thwaites Glacier, with the help of a drill that uses hot water to punch through ice.

title: Catherine O’Hara Was Always a Delight
summary: The Emmy-winning actress was especially adept at playing women who had been cast off but maintained an inflated sense of self, always with a great comedic payoff.

title: Russia’s Oil Revenue Is Plummeting
summary: The new reality has forced the Kremlin to raise taxes and increase debt, and hovers over peace talks with Ukraine.

title: The Latest Way to Create an Isolated Retreat: Buy a Whole Village
summary: Wealthy buyers and tourism entrepreneurs are acquiring abandoned European villages — school, church and bar included.
